hypothesis_content.title: Intraday False Breakout Fade in High Relative Strength Asset
hypothesis_content.statement: During a NEUTRAL/BEAR regime, an asset (e.g., top 10 cap coin) showing strong 5-day relative strength (> +5% vs. BTC) that makes a sharp 1-hour breakout to a 7-day high, but on sub-100% volume (vs. 1H avg), will experience a rapid mean reversion fade within the same trading session.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In weak or neutral regimes, assets with recent outperformance are prone to profit-taking. A low-volume breakout is often a bull trap/liquidity grab, lacking the broad participation needed for a sustained move. Fading this offers a high Sharpe ratio, quick turnaround trade.
entry_conditions: Asset makes a new 7-day high on 1H chart
1H breakout volume < 100% of its 1H 20-period average (low conviction)
Asset's 5-day performance vs. BTC > +5% (overextended relative strength)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces to the volume-weighted average price (VWAP) of the breakout 1H candle
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price sustains a second consecutive 1H close above the breakout high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Low-volume breakouts in strong relative strength assets continue to trend higher in >40% of cases, invalidating the 'trap' narrative.
